description: This trap is sent when a virtual machine is powered ON from a suspended
or a powered off state.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD VMWARE-OBSOLETE-MIB::vmPoweredOn VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmID i 9999 VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmConfigFilePath s EXAMPLE

description: This holds the same value as vmwVmVMID of the affected vm generating the trap.
to allow polling of the affected vm in vmwVmTable.
variables.name: VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmID

description: This is the path to the config file of the affected vm generating the trap
and is same as vmwVmTable vmwVmConfigFile. It is expressed as POSIX pathname.
variables.name: VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmConfigFilePath

description: This trap is sent when a virtual machine is powered OFF.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD VMWARE-OBSOLETE-MIB::vmPoweredOff VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmID i 9999 VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmConfigFilePath s EXAMPLE

description: This holds the same value as vmwVmVMID of the affected vm generating the trap.
to allow polling of the affected vm in vmwVmTable.
variables.name: VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmID

description: This is the path to the config file of the affected vm generating the trap
and is same as vmwVmTable vmwVmConfigFile. It is expressed as POSIX pathname.
variables.name: VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmConfigFilePath

description: This trap is sent when a virtual machine detects a loss in guest heartbeat.

event.Summary: Virtual machine $v1 detected a loss in guest heartbeat

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD VMWARE-OBSOLETE-MIB::vmHBLost VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmID i 9999 VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmConfigFilePath s EXAMPLE

description: This holds the same value as vmwVmVMID of the affected vm generating the trap.
to allow polling of the affected vm in vmwVmTable.
variables.name: VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmID

description: This is the path to the config file of the affected vm generating the trap
and is same as vmwVmTable vmwVmConfigFile. It is expressed as POSIX pathname.
variables.name: VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmConfigFilePath

description: This trap is sent when a virtual machine detects or regains the guest heartbeat.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD VMWARE-OBSOLETE-MIB::vmHBDetected VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmID i 9999 VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmConfigFilePath s EXAMPLE

description: This holds the same value as vmwVmVMID of the affected vm generating the trap.
to allow polling of the affected vm in vmwVmTable.
variables.name: VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmID

description: This is the path to the config file of the affected vm generating the trap
and is same as vmwVmTable vmwVmConfigFile. It is expressed as POSIX pathname.
variables.name: VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmConfigFilePath

description: This trap is sent when a virtual machine is suspended.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD VMWARE-OBSOLETE-MIB::vmSuspended VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmID i 9999 VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmConfigFilePath s EXAMPLE

description: This holds the same value as vmwVmVMID of the affected vm generating the trap.
to allow polling of the affected vm in vmwVmTable.
variables.name: VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmID

description: This is the path to the config file of the affected vm generating the trap
and is same as vmwVmTable vmwVmConfigFile. It is expressed as POSIX pathname.
variables.name: VMWARE-VMINFO-MIB::vmwVmConfigFilePath

description: This trap is sent when entity status changed.

event.Summary: Current entity status for VM $v3 is $v4

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD VMWARE-OBSOLETE-MIB::vpxdTrap VMWARE-OBSOLETE-MIB::vpxdTrapType s EXAMPLE VMWARE-OBSOLETE-MIB::vpxdHostName s EXAMPLE VMWARE-OBSOLETE-MIB::vpxdVMName s EXAMPLE VMWARE-OBSOLETE-MIB::vpxdNewStatus s EXAMPLE VMWARE-OBSOLETE-MIB::vpxdOldStatus s EXAMPLE VMWARE-OBSOLETE-MIB::vpxdObjValue s EXAMPLE

description: This is the trap type in the preceding traps.
variables.name: VMWARE-OBSOLETE-MIB::vpxdTrapType

description: This is the name of the host in the preceding traps.
variables.name: VMWARE-OBSOLETE-MIB::vpxdHostName

description: This is the name of the VM in the preceding traps.
variables.name: VMWARE-OBSOLETE-MIB::vpxdVMName

description: This is the new status in the preceding traps.
variables.name: VMWARE-OBSOLETE-MIB::vpxdNewStatus

description: This is the old status in the preceding traps.
variables.name: VMWARE-OBSOLETE-MIB::vpxdOldStatus

description: This is the current object value in the preceding traps.
variables.name: VMWARE-OBSOLETE-MIB::vpxdObjValue
